passage:
(1) Benjamin Franklin, one of America's most illustrious founding fathers, exemplified the spirit of innovation and pragmatism that would come to characterize the nascent republic. Born in 1706 to a modest Boston family, Franklin received minimal formal education yet demonstrated an insatiable intellectual curiosity from an early age. After apprenticing in his brother's printing shop, he established himself in Philadelphia, where his capacious mind and entrepreneurial acumen facilitated his rise from impoverished runaway to wealthy businessman. Franklin's periodical, 'The Pennsylvania Gazette,' and his annual publication, 'Poor Richard's Almanack,' not only secured his financial independence but also served as platforms for disseminating his practical philosophy and wit.

(2) Franklin's contributions to science were equally remarkable, reflecting his commitment to observation and experimentation rather than abstract theorizing. His investigations into electricity, culminating in his famous kite experiment, led to the invention of the lightning rod and established him as a preeminent scientist in colonial America. With alacrity, he embraced the role of inventor, creating bifocal glasses, the Franklin stove, and an improved odometer, among other innovations. Unlike many intellectuals of his era who consecrated themselves to purely theoretical pursuits, Franklin sought practical applications for scientific knowledge, embodying the principle that understanding natural phenomena should improve human life.

(3) In the political sphere, Franklin's influence proved instrumental in shaping the young nation's trajectory. As a diplomat in France during the American Revolution, he secured crucial military and financial support that contributed significantly to American victory. His persuasive abilities and cosmopolitan sensibilities enabled him to navigate the sophisticated European diplomatic landscape with remarkable dexterity, transforming him into a celebrity among the French intelligentsia. Later, as the oldest delegate to the Constitutional Convention of 1787, Franklin's wisdom and conciliatory nature helped bridge divides between factions with seemingly irreparable differences, contributing substantially to the creation of a sustainable governmental framework.

(4) Perhaps less celebrated but equally significant was Franklin's commitment to civic improvement. He founded Philadelphia's first lending library, organized the city's first fire company, established an academy that would eventually become the University of Pennsylvania, and formed a philosophical society to promote useful knowledge. These institutions reflected his belief that social progress depended on collective action and the sharing of knowledge. Unlike many of his contemporaries who harbored melancholy views about human nature, Franklin maintained an optimistic outlook, believing that properly structured institutions could channel self-interest toward the common good.

(5) Franklin's complex legacy continues to resonate in American culture and beyond. His autobiography, which chronicles his pursuit of moral perfection through the systematic cultivation of virtues, remains a foundational text in the American ethos of self-improvement. However, contemporary scholars have brought greater attention to the contradictions within his life, including his ownership of slaves (though he later became an abolitionist) and his sometimes problematic personal relationships. Such reassessments do not diminish Franklin's achievements but rather situate him within the messier realities of history, revealing him as neither a flawless hero nor a hypocrite, but as a human being whose extraordinary intellect and ambition drove both remarkable accomplishments and notable inconsistencies.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences contains a grammatically correct use of the past perfect tense?

options.A: Before the lecture began, the professor had prepared all his materials.
options.B: Before the lecture began, the professor has prepared all his materials.
options.C: Before the lecture began, the professor was preparing all his materials.
options.D: Before the lecture began, the professor prepared all his materials.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct use of the subjunctive mood:

options.A: The committee recommended that she will attend the conference.
options.B: The committee recommended that she attends the conference.
options.C: The committee recommended that she attend the conference.
options.D: The committee recommended that she attended the conference.

questions.question: Choose the option with the correct subject-verb agreement:

options.A: The number of students enrolled in the course have increased.
options.B: The number of students enrolled in the course has increased.
options.C: A number of students enrolled in the course has increased.
options.D: A number of students enrolled in the course is increasing.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a relative clause?

options.A: The museum which we visited yesterday houses an impressive collection.
options.B: The museum whom we visited yesterday houses an impressive collection.
options.C: The museum whose we visited yesterday houses an impressive collection.
options.D: The museum who we visited yesterday houses an impressive collection.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct verb form:

options.A: If she would have studied harder, she would have passed the exam.
options.B: If she had studied harder, she would passed the exam.
options.C: If she had studied harder, she would have passed the exam.
options.D: If she would study harder, she would have passed the exam.

questions.question: Which sentence demonstrates correct parallel structure?

options.A: The professor enjoys reading novels, watching documentaries, and to hike in the mountains.
options.B: The professor enjoys reading novels, watching documentaries, and hiking in the mountains.
options.C: The professor enjoys to read novels, watching documentaries, and hiking in the mountains.
options.D: The professor enjoys reading novels, to watch documentaries, and hiking in the mountains.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of articles:

options.A: She has a MA in linguistics from an prestigious university.
options.B: She has an MA in linguistics from a prestigious university.
options.C: She has a MA in linguistics from a prestigious university.
options.D: She has an MA in linguistics from an prestigious university.

questions.question: Select the correct form of the passive voice:

options.A: The research paper is being written by the professor.
options.B: The research paper is being writing by the professor.
options.C: The research paper is been written by the professor.
options.D: The research paper is been writing by the professor.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a gerund?

options.A: They postponed to make a decision until next week.
options.B: They postponed making a decision until next week.
options.C: They postponed make a decision until next week.
options.D: They postponed that they make a decision until next week.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence with reported speech:

options.A: The director said that the meeting has been rescheduled.
options.B: The director said that the meeting will be rescheduled.
options.C: The director said that the meeting had been rescheduled.
options.D: The director said that the meeting is being rescheduled.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct use of a dangling modifier:

options.A: Walking through the forest, the birds sang beautifully.
options.B: Walking through the forest, we heard the birds singing beautifully.
options.C: Walking through the forest, beautiful songs came from the birds.
options.D: Walking through the forest, it was beautiful to hear the birds sing.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of the perfect infinitive:

options.A: She claims to studied extensively for the examination.
options.B: She claims to have study extensively for the examination.
options.C: She claims to have studied extensively for the examination.
options.D: She claims to had studied extensively for the examination.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the future perfect tense?

options.A: By next year, they will completed the construction of the new stadium.
options.B: By next year, they will have completed the construction of the new stadium.
options.C: By next year, they will be completing the construction of the new stadium.
options.D: By next year, they will have been completed the construction of the new stadium.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct placement of adverbs:

options.A: She nearly read all of the assigned chapters.
options.B: She read nearly all of the assigned chapters.
options.C: She read all nearly of the assigned chapters.
options.D: She read all of nearly the assigned chapters.

questions.question: Select the sentence with correct subject-verb agreement in a complex structure:

options.A: Either the professors or the principal are going to make an announcement.
options.B: Either the professors or the principal is going to make an announcement.
options.C: Either the principal or the professors is going to make an announcement.
options.D: Either the principal or the professors have going to make an announcement.

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'The results of the study are inconsistent _____ previous findings.'
Select the most appropriate phrasal verb to complete the sentence: 'After careful consideration, the committee decided to _____ the controversial proposal.'
Which idiomatic expression best completes the sentence: 'The negotiations have reached _____, with neither side willing to compromise.'
Choose the most appropriate word to complete the sentence: 'Despite the initial challenges, the project was ultimately brought to _____ completion.'
Select the correct collocation: 'The government has implemented strict measures to _____ crime in urban areas.'
Which expression best completes the sentence: 'After years of reckless spending, the company is finally _____ the consequences of its financial decisions.'
Choose the most suitable conjunction to join these sentences: 'The research had methodological flaws. The conclusions were still valuable.'
Select the correct form: 'By the time the ambulance arrived, the patient _____ consciousness.'
Which phrase best completes the sentence: 'The professor's explanation was so convoluted that it only served to _____ the students' confusion.'
Choose the most appropriate linking expression: 'The company reported record profits; _____, employee satisfaction has reached an all-time low.'
Which word means 'beyond repair or correction'?
Which word describes someone who talks excessively, especially about trivial matters?
Which term refers to something capable of being shaped or formed, especially by pressure?
Which word describes a substance that softens or soothes the skin?
Which word describes someone who acts without moral principles or ethics?
Which term refers to brisk cheerfulness or eagerness?
Which word describes something lacking in substance, nutrition, or interest; intellectually insubstantial?
Which verb means to make or declare sacred, especially to dedicate formally to a religious purpose?
Which adjective describes something supernatural, mystical, or magical, not revealed or displayed to the public?
Which noun refers to the process of growth or increase by the gradual accumulation of additional layers or matter?
Which word describes a feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause?
Which adjective means having a lot of space inside; roomy?
Which noun refers to a special liking or particular taste for something?
Which term describes a long, angry speech of bitter criticism or accusation?
Which word refers to a wasting away or decrease in size of a body part or tissue?
According to paragraph 1, what contributed to Franklin's financial independence?
The word 'nascent' in paragraph 1 is closest in meaning to:
According to paragraph 2, how did Franklin's approach to science differ from many intellectuals of his era?

options.A: He focused on theoretical rather than practical applications
options.B: He sought practical applications for scientific knowledge
options.D: He concentrated exclusively on electrical phenomena

questions.question: In paragraph 3, the author suggests that Franklin's diplomatic success in France was primarily due to:

options.C: His persuasive abilities and cosmopolitan sensibilities

questions.question: The phrase 'bridge divides' in paragraph 3 most likely means:
According to paragraph 4, Franklin's civic institutions reflected his belief that:

options.A: Individual achievement was the key to social progress
options.B: Government intervention was necessary for civic improvement
options.D: Collective action and knowledge sharing drive social progress

questions.question: Based on the final paragraph, how do contemporary scholars view Franklin?

options.A: As a flawless hero of American history
options.B: As a hypocrite whose achievements are overrated
options.C: As a complex figure with both achievements and contradictions
options.D: As primarily significant for his autobiography

questions.question: The passage characterizes Franklin's autobiography as:

options.B: A foundational text in American self-improvement culture
options.C: An attempt to conceal his personal contradictions

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the main purpose of the passage?

options.A: To compare Franklin to other founding fathers
options.B: To criticize historical misconceptions about Franklin
options.D: To present Franklin's diverse contributions and complex legacy

questions.question: The tone of the passage could best be described as:
